div.bibl: Interview with Mr. N. I. Kozak, Secretary of the Russian Independent Mutual Aid Society. (Nov. 30, 1936.) By D. Stranden SCHOOLS CONNECTED WITH THE R. I. M. A. S.

body.p: There are several such schools: the Krylov Memorial School, the Bunin Memorial School (on Carty Street), and others.

Mr. Kozak could not give me any exact information as to their number and location. Some of the schools have fallen into the hands of the Communists; those named after Dostoyevsky, Pushkin, Gorkiy and the Douglas Park School. All these form a separate Communist school federation.
